summary.p: Announces that after [Christoph] Froschauer's return from Frankfurt, [Sebastian] Münster's [„Cosmographia“] will be sent; Münster is currently expanding the [„Geographia universalis“ of Ptolemy], as a friend from Basel [Johannes Gast] reported. Vadian is pleased with [Stumpf's description of] Thurgau and will provide a written opinion on it. Bullinger includes the catalog of the provosts of the Zürich church by the hand of the provost [Felix Frey]; the catalog of the abbesses will follow later. Leodegar Hirsgarter is already working on the list of Gothic and Frankish kings; Bullinger has not yet seen a catalog of the Burgundian kings. After his return, Froschauer will bring the tables to Stumpf; Bullinger is surprised why Münster changed his decision. Greetings. [Enclosure:] List of names of the Zürich provosts from Rudolf to Felix Frey.

div.p: Heinrich Bullinger to Johannes Stumpf, greetings. Froschauer, when I was writing this, had not yet returned, dearest brother; when he returns, I will ensure that you have Münster's rhapsody. However, I will not hide what a certain friend from Basel has given me these days, that Münster is now preparing a new edition and will remove and add many things. For what reason or on what occasion, I do not know.
Vadian is pleased with your Thurgau, although he has not yet fully written his judgment on it. However, he promises. For I have diligently discussed it with the man.

After I receive something, I will give it in good faith. I am sending here the catalog of the provosts of the Zürich church, as much as we could have. The hand is that of the provost. I will send the catalog of the abbesses later. Now I am sending here what I could have. I can find very little of the heavenly whores, but I will continue to search further. I think God does not want them to have any memory on earth.

Leodegar Hirsgarter is already writing the series of Gothic and Frankish kings. Tomorrow, I believe, it will be ready by 8 o'clock in the morning. I have never seen a catalog of the kings of Burgundy.
Froschauer will ensure the tables are delivered to you as soon as he returns. I wonder why Münster is now changing his plan. If you have any certainty, let me know.
Greet your beloved wife from me and my wife. Farewell. Zürich, September 26, very hastily, at the fourth hour in the afternoon, in the year 1544.
